techmeme.title: CrowdStrike shares a root cause analysis of the July 19 outage, and says it's working with two third-party software security vendors to conduct further review (Jessica Lyons/The Register)
Coupang reports Q2 revenue up 25% YoY to $7.3B and a net loss of $77M, its first loss since 2022, due to its Farfetch deal and a South Korean regulatory fine (Yoolim Lee/Bloomberg)
Brian Chesky says Airbnb plans to expand into new products and services, including co-hosting this fall, guest services, and a relaunch of experiences next year (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
OpenAI unveils Structure Outputs in the API, a feature to ensure model-generated outputs match JSON Schemas, and lower pricing for a new version of GPT-4o (Michelle Pokrass/OpenAI)
California's AI safety bill will harm developers, open-source development, the public sector, and academia, while failing to address the potential harms of AI (Fei-Fei Li/Fortune)
